content.description:
1. 5.10a, follow unprotected face for miles past a single bolt to a small ledge on a shallow left facing half-moon shaped feature that has a water streak running out of the bottom.

2. 5.8, follow more uprotected face for miles to the top.

Good Luck

Incredible thin-edge face climbing on very hard gold-colored glacial-polished rock.

1. 5.10b/c. Climb up over a small roof (#2 cam) and to a small ledge above. Place a TCU and move left on face to a bolt, then follow a line of bolts straight up the water streak to a 3-bolt belay. Cruxes will be encountered under the final two protection bolts.

2. 5.8. Climb a long stretch straight up to a bolt, then another long stretch to another bolt somewhat to the left at a steeper and very gold-polished section. Then do the 5.8 crux, and with a little devious route finding, you can keep the grade at 5.8 to the top.
content.protection: Small cams to 2 inch and draws. This is NOT a sport climb.
content.location: Just right of the center of the slab a thin, grey water streak can be seen. This is Voyager.

content.description:
1. Follow the lower, left water streak past 4 bolts (crux) to a ledge and follow the ledge right to its end at a shallow corner (small gear belay).

2. Follow the upper, right water steak to the summit past one bolt. Don't expect to find much pro but the climbing gets easier as you go.
content.location: The 2 most prominent features on the right side of the slab are a left-facing inverted-staircase dihedral (this is Barefoot Bumpkin) and to the left of that, a wide black water streak that has a jog in it formed by a ledge. This is Deep Space.

content.description:
1. 5.8, climb up polished face (crux) to reach the bottom of the dihedral.

2. 5.6\7, Follow the dihedral to the top.
content.location: On the right side of Pluto Slab is a left-facing, inverted-staircase feature. This is barefoot bumpkin.
